options.name: chart--type
options.title: type
options.description: The default series type for the chart. Can be any of the chart types listed under plotOptions.

options.name: chart--inverted
options.title: inverted
options.description:
Whether to invert the axes so that the x axis is vertical and y axis is horizontal. When true, the x axis is reversed by default. If a bar series is present in the chart, it will be inverted automatically.

Inverting the chart doesn't have an effect if there are no cartesian series in the chart, or if the chart is polar.

options.name: chart--animation
options.title: animation
options.description:
Set the overall animation for all chart updating. Animation can be disabled throughout the chart by setting it to false here. It can be overridden for each individual API method as a function parameter. The only animation not affected by this option is the initial series animation, see plotOptions.series.animation.

The animation can either be set as a boolean or a configuration object. If true, it will use the 'swing' jQuery easing and a duration of 500 ms. If used as a configuration object, the following properties are supported:

duration
The duration of the animation in milliseconds.
easing
A string reference to an easing function set on the Math object. See the easing demo.
options.demo: Updating with no animation, with a longer duration, with a jQuery UI easing.

options.name: chart--zoomType
options.title: zooming
options.description: Decides in what dimensions the user can zoom by dragging the mouse. Can be one of x, y or xy.
options.demo: None by default, x, y, xy

options.name: plotOptions-series--stacking
options.title: stacking
options.description: Whether to stack the values of each series on top of each other. Possible values are null to disable, "normal" to stack by value or "percent".
options.demo: Line, column, bar, area with "normal" stacking. Line, column, bar, area with "percent" stacking.

options.name: plotOptions-series--step
options.title: step(line)
options.description: Whether to apply steps to the line. Possible values are left, center and right. Prior to 2.3.5, only left was supported.
options.demo: Different step line options. Stepped, stacked area.

options.name: chart--width
options.title: width
options.description: An explicit width for the chart. By default (when null) the width is calculated from the offset width of the containing element.

options.name: chart--height
options.title: height
options.description: An explicit height for the chart. By default (when null) the height is calculated from the offset height of the containing element, or 400 pixels if the containing element's height is 0.

options.name: chart--spacingTop
options.title: spacingTop
options.description: The space between the top edge of the chart and the content (plot area, axis title and labels, title, subtitle or legend in top position).
options.demo: A top spacing of 100, floating chart title makes the plot area align to the default spacingTop of 10..

options.name: chart--spacingRight
options.title: spacingRight
options.description: The space between the right edge of the chart and the content (plot area, axis title and labels, title, subtitle or legend in top position).
options.demo: Spacing set to 100, legend in right position with default spacing

options.name: chart--spacingBottom
options.title: spacingBottom
options.description: The space between the bottom edge of the chart and the content (plot area, axis title and labels, title, subtitle or legend in top position).

options.name: chart--spacingLeft
options.title: spacingLeft
options.description: The space between the left edge of the chart and the content (plot area, axis title and labels, title, subtitle or legend in top position).

options.name: title--text
options.title: chart title
options.description: The title of the chart. To disable the title, set the text to null.

options.name: subtitle--text
options.title: chart subtitle
options.description: The subtitle of the chart.
options.demo: Custom subtitle, formatted and linked text.

options.name: colors
options.title: Series colors
options.description:
An array containing the default colors for the chart's series. When all colors are used, new colors are pulled from the start again. Defaults to: 

colors: ['#7cb5ec', '#434348', '#90ed7d', '#f7a35c', '#8085e9', 
   '#f15c80', '#e4d354', '#2b908f', '#f45b5b', '#91e8e1']
Default colors can also be set on a series or series.type basis, see column.colors, pie.colors.

Legacy

In Highcharts 3.x, the default colors were: 

colors: ['#2f7ed8', '#0d233a', '#8bbc21', '#910000', '#1aadce', 
   '#492970', '#f28f43', '#77a1e5', '#c42525', '#a6c96a']

In Highcharts 2.x, the default colors were: 

colors: ['#4572A7', '#AA4643', '#89A54E', '#80699B', '#3D96AE', 
   '#DB843D', '#92A8CD', '#A47D7C', '#B5CA92']

options.name: chart--backgroundColor
options.title: backgroundColor
options.description: The background color or gradient for the outer chart area.

options.name: chart--borderWidth
options.title: borderWidth
options.description: The pixel width of the outer chart border.

options.name: chart--borderRadius
options.title: borderRadius
options.description: The corner radius of the outer chart border.

options.name: chart--borderColor
options.title: borderColor
options.description: The color of the outer chart border.

options.name: chart--plotBackgroundColor
options.title: plotBackgroundColor
options.description: The background color or gradient for the plot area.

options.name: chart--plotBackgroundImage
options.title: plotBackgroundImage
options.description: The URL for an image to use as the plot background. To set an image as the background for the entire chart, set a CSS background image to the container element. Note that for the image to be applied to exported charts, its URL needs to be accessible by the export server.

options.name: chart--plotBorderWidth
options.title: plotBorderWidth
options.description: The pixel width of the plot area border.

options.name: chart--plotBorderColor
options.title: plotBorderColor
options.description: The color of the inner chart or plot area border.

options.name: chart--inverted
options.title: inverted
options.description:
Whether to invert the axes so that the x axis is vertical and y axis is horizontal. When true, the x axis is reversed by default. If a bar series is present in the chart, it will be inverted automatically.

Inverting the chart doesn't have an effect if there are no cartesian series in the chart, or if the chart is polar.

options.name: xAxis-title--text
options.title: text
options.description: The actual text of the axis title. It can contain basic HTML text markup like <b>, <i> and spans with style.
options.demo: Custom HTML title for X axis

options.name: xAxis--type
options.title: type
options.description: The type of axis. Can be one of linear, logarithmic, datetime or category. In a datetime axis, the numbers are given in milliseconds, and tick marks are placed on appropriate values like full hours or days. In a category axis, the point names of the chart's series are used for categories, if not a categories array is defined.
options.demo: "linear", "datetime" with regular intervals, "datetime" with irregular intervals, "logarithmic", "logarithmic" with minor grid lines, "logarithmic" on two axes.

options.name: xAxis--categories
options.title: categories
options.description:
If categories are present for the xAxis, names are used instead of numbers for that axis. Since Highcharts 3.0, categories can also be extracted by giving each point a name and setting axis type to category. However, if you have multiple series, best practice remains defining the categories array.

Example: 

categories: ['Apples', 'Bananas', 'Oranges']
Defaults to null

options.name: xAxis--min
options.title: min
options.description: The minimum value of the axis. If null the min value is automatically calculated. If the startOnTick option is true, the min value might be rounded down.
options.demo: Y axis min of -50 with startOnTick to false, -50 with startOnTick true by default

options.name: xAxis--max
options.title: max
options.description:
The maximum value of the axis. If null, the max value is automatically calculated. If the endOnTick option is true, the max value might be rounded up.

If a tickAmount is set, the axis may be extended beyond the set max in order to reach the given number of ticks. The same may happen in a chart with multiple axes, determined by chart.alignTicks, where a tickAmount is applied internally.
options.demo: Y axis max of 200, Y axis max on logarithmic axis

options.name: xAxis--opposite
options.title: opposite
options.description: Whether to display the axis on the opposite side of the normal. The normal is on the left side for vertical axes and bottom for horizontal, so the opposite sides will be right and top respectively. This is typically used with dual or multiple axes.

options.name: xAxis--reversed
options.title: reversed
options.description: Whether to reverse the axis so that the highest number is closest to the origin. If the chart is inverted, the x axis is reversed by default.

options.name: xAxis--tickWidth
options.title: tickWidth
options.description: The pixel width of the major tick marks.

options.name: xAxis--tickInterval
options.title: tickInterval
options.description:
The interval of the tick marks in axis units. When null, the tick interval is computed to approximately follow the tickPixelInterval on linear and datetime axes. On categorized axes, a null tickInterval will default to 1, one category. Note that datetime axes are based on milliseconds, so for example an interval of one day is expressed as 24 * 3600 * 1000.

On logarithmic axes, the tickInterval is based on powers, so a tickInterval of 1 means one tick on each of 0.1, 1, 10, 100 etc. A tickInterval of 2 means a tick of 0.1, 10, 1000 etc. A tickInterval of 0.2 puts a tick on 0.1, 0.2, 0.4, 0.6, 0.8, 1, 2, 4, 6, 8, 10, 20, 40 etc.

If the tickInterval is too dense for labels to be drawn, Highcharts may remove ticks.

If the chart has multiple axes, the alignTicks option may interfere with the tickInterval setting.
options.demo: Tick interval of 5 on a linear axis

options.name: xAxis-labels--enabled
options.title: labels
options.description: Enable or disable the axis labels.

options.name: xAxis-labels--format
options.title: label format
options.description: A format string for the axis label.
options.demo: Add units to Y axis label

options.name: xAxis-labels--rotation
options.title: rotation
options.description: Rotation of the labels in degrees.

options.name: xAxis-labels--align
options.title: align
options.description: What part of the string the given position is anchored to. Can be one of "left", "center" or "right". Defaults to an intelligent guess based on which side of the chart the axis is on and the rotation of the label.

options.name: xAxis-plotLines
options.title: plotLines
options.description: An array of lines stretching across the plot area, marking a specific value on one of the axes.

options.name: xAxis-plotLines--color
options.title: color
options.description: The color of the line.
options.demo: A red line from X axis

options.name: xAxis-plotLines--dashStyle
options.title: dashStyle
options.description: The dashing or dot style for the plot line. For possible values see this overview.

options.name: xAxis-plotLines-label--text
options.title: text
options.description: The text itself. A subset of HTML is supported.

options.name: xAxis-plotLines--value
options.title: value
options.description: The position of the line in axis units.
options.demo: Between two categories on X axis

options.name: xAxis-plotLines--width
options.title: width
options.description: The width or thickness of the plot line.
options.demo: 2px wide line from X axis

options.name: xAxis-plotBands
options.title: plotBands
options.description:
An array of colored bands stretching across the plot area marking an interval on the axis.

In a gauge, a plot band on the Y axis (value axis) will stretch along the perimeter of the gauge.

options.name: xAxis-plotBands--color
options.title: color
options.description: The color of the plot band.

options.name: xAxis-plotBands-label--text
options.title: text
options.description: The string text itself. A subset of HTML is supported.

options.name: xAxis-plotBands--from
options.title: from
options.description: The start position of the plot band in axis units.

options.name: xAxis-plotBands--to
options.title: to
options.description: The end position of the plot band in axis units.

options.name: yAxis-title--text
options.title: text
options.description: The actual text of the axis title. Horizontal texts can contain HTML, but rotated texts are painted using vector techniques and must be clean text. The Y axis title is disabled by setting the text option to null.
options.demo: Custom HTML title for X axis

options.name: yAxis--type
options.title: type
options.description: The type of axis. Can be one of linear, logarithmic, datetime or category. In a datetime axis, the numbers are given in milliseconds, and tick marks are placed on appropriate values like full hours or days. In a category axis, the point names of the chart's series are used for categories, if not a categories array is defined.
options.demo: "linear", "datetime" with regular intervals, "datetime" with irregular intervals, "logarithmic", "logarithmic" with minor grid lines, "logarithmic" on two axes.

options.name: yAxis--min
options.title: min
options.description:
The minimum value of the axis. If null the min value is automatically calculated.

If the startOnTick option is true, the min value might be rounded down.

The automatically calculated minimum value is also affected by floor, minPadding, minRange as well as series.threshold and series.softThreshold.
options.demo: Y axis min of -50 with startOnTick to false, -50 with startOnTick true by default

options.name: yAxis--max
options.title: max
options.description:
The maximum value of the axis. If null, the max value is automatically calculated. If the endOnTick option is true, the max value might be rounded up.

If a tickAmount is set, the axis may be extended beyond the set max in order to reach the given number of ticks. The same may happen in a chart with multiple axes, determined by chart.alignTicks, where a tickAmount is applied internally.
options.demo: Y axis max of 200, Y axis max on logarithmic axis

options.name: yAxis--minColor
options.title: minColor
options.description: Solid gauge only. Unless stops are set, the color to represent the minimum value of the Y axis.

options.name: yAxis--maxColor
options.title: maxColor
options.description: Solid gauge only. Unless stops are set, the color to represent the maximum value of the Y axis.

options.name: yAxis--opposite
options.title: opposite
options.description: Whether to display the axis on the opposite side of the normal. The normal is on the left side for vertical axes and bottom for horizontal, so the opposite sides will be right and top respectively. This is typically used with dual or multiple axes.

options.name: yAxis--reversed
options.title: reversed
options.description: Whether to reverse the axis so that the highest number is closest to the origin. If the chart is inverted, the x axis is reversed by default.

options.name: yAxis--tickWidth
options.title: tickWidth
options.description: The pixel width of the major tick marks.

options.name: yAxis--tickInterval
options.title: tickInterval
options.description:
The interval of the tick marks in axis units. When null, the tick interval is computed to approximately follow the tickPixelInterval on linear and datetime axes. On categorized axes, a null tickInterval will default to 1, one category. Note that datetime axes are based on milliseconds, so for example an interval of one day is expressed as 24 * 3600 * 1000.

On logarithmic axes, the tickInterval is based on powers, so a tickInterval of 1 means one tick on each of 0.1, 1, 10, 100 etc. A tickInterval of 2 means a tick of 0.1, 10, 1000 etc. A tickInterval of 0.2 puts a tick on 0.1, 0.2, 0.4, 0.6, 0.8, 1, 2, 4, 6, 8, 10, 20, 40 etc.

If the tickInterval is too dense for labels to be drawn, Highcharts may remove ticks.

If the chart has multiple axes, the alignTicks option may interfere with the tickInterval setting.
options.demo: Tick interval of 5 on a linear axis

options.name: yAxis-labels--enabled
options.title: labels
options.description: Enable or disable the axis labels.

options.name: yAxis-labels--format
options.title: format
options.description: A format string for the axis label.
options.demo: Add units to Y axis label

options.name: yAxis-labels--rotation
options.title: rotation
options.description: Rotation of the labels in degrees.

options.name: yAxis-plotLines
options.title: plotLines
options.description: An array of objects representing plot lines on the X axis

options.name: yAxis-plotLines--color
options.title: color
options.description: The color of the line.
options.demo: A red line from X axis

options.name: yAxis-plotLines--dashStyle
options.title: dashStyle
options.description: The dashing or dot style for the plot line. For possible values see this overview.

options.name: yAxis-plotLines-label--text
options.title: text
options.description: The text itself. A subset of HTML is supported.

options.name: yAxis-plotLines--value
options.title: value
options.description: The position of the line in axis units.
options.demo: Between two categories on X axis

options.name: yAxis-plotLines--width
options.title: width
options.description: The width or thickness of the plot line.
options.demo: 2px wide line from X axis

options.name: yAxis-plotBands
options.title: plotBands
options.description: An array of objects defining plot bands on the Y axis.

options.name: yAxis-plotBands--color
options.title: color
options.description: The color of the plot band.

options.name: yAxis-plotBands-label--text
options.title: text
options.description: The string text itself. A subset of HTML is supported.

options.name: yAxis-plotBands--from
options.title: from
options.description: The start position of the plot band in axis units.

options.name: yAxis-plotBands--to
options.title: to
options.description: The end position of the plot band in axis units.

options.name: yAxis--stops
options.title: Color stops (for solid gauge only)
options.description:
Solid gauge series only. Color stops for the solid gauge. Use this in cases where a linear gradient between a minColor and maxColor is not sufficient. The stops is an array of tuples, where the first item is a float between 0 and 1 assigning the relative position in the gradient, and the second item is the color.

For solid gauges, the Y axis also inherits the concept of data classes from the Highmaps color axis.

options.name: series--name
options.title: name
options.description: The name of the series as shown in the legend, tooltip etc.

options.name: series--type
options.title: type
options.description: The type of series. Can be one of area, areaspline, bar, column, line, pie, scatter or spline. From version 2.3, arearange, areasplinerange and columnrange are supported with the highcharts-more.js component.
options.demo: Line and column in the same chart

options.name: series--index
options.title: index
options.description: The index of the series in the chart, affecting the internal index in the chart.series array, the visible Z index as well as the order in the legend.

options.name: series--stack
options.title: stack
options.description: This option allows grouping series in a stacked chart. The stack option can be a string  or a number or anything else, as long as the grouped series' stack options match each other.

options.name: series--xAxis
options.title: xAxis
options.description: When using dual or multiple x axes, this number defines which xAxis the particular series is connected to. It refers to either the axis id or the index of the axis in the xAxis array, with 0 being the first.

options.name: series--yAxis
options.title: yAxis
options.description: When using dual or multiple y axes, this number defines which yAxis the particular series is connected to. It refers to either the axis id or the index of the axis in the yAxis array, with 0 being the first.
options.demo: Apply the column series to the secondary Y axis

options.name: plotOptions-series-dataLabels--enabled
options.title: enable value labels for all series
options.description: Enable or disable the data labels.

options.name: plotOptions-series-dataLabels--format
options.title: data label format
options.description: A format string for the data label. Available variables are the same as for formatter.

options.name: legend--enabled
options.title: enabled
options.description: Enable or disable the legend.

options.name: legend--layout
options.title: layout
options.description: The layout of the legend items. Can be one of "horizontal" or "vertical".

options.name: legend--align
options.title: align
options.description:
The horizontal alignment of the legend box within the chart area. Valid values are left, center and right.

In the case that the legend is aligned in a corner position, the layout option will determine whether to place it above/below or on the side of the plot area.
options.demo: Legend at the right of the chart

options.name: legend--verticalAlign
options.title: verticalAlign
options.description:
The vertical alignment of the legend box. Can be one of top, middle or bottom. Vertical position can be further determined by the y option.

In the case that the legend is aligned in a corner position, the layout option will determine whether to place it above/below or on the side of the plot area.
options.demo: Legend 100px from the top of the chart

options.name: tooltip--enabled
options.title: enabled
options.description: Enable or disable the tooltip.
options.demo: Disabled, disable tooltip and show values on chart instead.

options.name: tooltip--followPointer
options.title: followPointer
options.description:
Whether the tooltip should follow the mouse as it moves across columns, pie slices and other point types with an extent. By default it behaves this way for scatter, bubble and pie series by override in the plotOptions for those series types.

For touch moves to behave the same way, followTouchMove must be true also.

options.name: tooltip--headerFormat
options.title: headerFormat
options.description:
The HTML of the tooltip header line. Variables are enclosed by curly brackets. Available variables are point.key, series.name, series.color and other members from the point and series objects. The point.key variable contains the category name, x value or datetime string depending on the type of axis. For datetime axes, the point.key date format can be set using tooltip.xDateFormat.

Defaults to <span style="font-size: 10px">{point.key}</span><br/>
options.demo: A HTML table in the tooltip

options.name: tooltip--pointFormat
options.title: pointFormat
options.description: The HTML of the point's line in the tooltip. Variables are enclosed by curly brackets. Available variables are point.x, point.y, series.name and series.color and other properties on the same form. Furthermore, point.y can be extended by the tooltip.valuePrefix and tooltip.valueSuffix variables. This can also be overridden for each series, which makes it a good hook for displaying units.
options.demo: A different point format with value suffix

options.name: tooltip--valuePrefix
options.title: valuePrefix
options.description: A string to prepend to each series' y value. Overridable in each series' tooltip options object.
options.demo: Set decimals, prefix and suffix for the value

options.name: tooltip--valueSuffix
options.title: valueSuffix
options.description: A string to append to each series' y value. Overridable in each series' tooltip options object.
options.demo: Set decimals, prefix and suffix for the value

options.name: tooltip--backgroundColor
options.title: backgroundColor
options.description: The background color or gradient for the tooltip.

options.name: tooltip--borderWidth
options.title: borderWidth
options.description: The pixel width of the tooltip border.
options.demo: 2px by default,, no border (shadow only)

options.name: tooltip--borderRadius
options.title: borderRadius
options.description: The radius of the rounded border corners.

options.name: tooltip--borderColor
options.title: borderColor
options.description: The color of the tooltip border. When null, the border takes the color of the corresponding series or point.
options.demo: Follow series by default, black border

options.name: exporting--enabled
options.title: enabled
options.description: Whether to enable the exporting module. Disabling the module will hide the context button, but API methods will still be available.
options.demo: Exporting module is loaded but disabled

options.name: exporting--sourceWidth
options.title: exported width
options.description: The width of the original chart when exported, unless an explicit chart.width is set. The width exported raster image is then multiplied by scale.

options.name: exporting--sourceHeight
options.title: exported height
options.description: Analogous to sourceWidth

options.name: exporting--scale
options.title: scaling factor
options.description: Defines the scale or zoom factor for the exported image compared to the on-screen display. While for instance a 600px wide chart may look good on a website, it will look bad in print. The default scale of 2 makes this chart export to a 1200px PNG or JPG.

options.name: credits--enabled
options.title: enable credits
options.description: Whether to show the credits text.

options.name: credits--text
options.title: credits text
options.description: The text for the credits label.

options.name: credits--href
options.title: link
options.description: The URL for the credits label.
